meanings.definition: To reverse the process of selling.
meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she quickly unsold the item.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to unsell their old products to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent3: He unsold the broken toy car and got a good laugh out of it.
meanings.sent4: The magician unsold the disappearing act by revealing the hidden compartment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unsold the incorrect answer by explaining it clearly.

meanings.sent1: The damaged goods were considered unselling and were thrown away.
meanings.sent2: The unique artwork was deemed unselling due to its high price.
meanings.sent3: The unselling items gathered dust in the forgotten corner of the store.
meanings.sent4: The unselling property remained on the market for months without any interest.
meanings.sent5: The unselling car sat in the garage, waiting for repairs that never came.
